main event: A bright orange-white oblong object was observed going straight up from a location 6 miles southeast of Alexandria, Louisiana, on June 20, 1959.
interesting points: The object was described as being the size of a pea,The color of the object was typical of a balloon at dusk which may have contributed to the reported glow,The sighting lasted approximately 5 minutes,Five witnesses corroborated the sighting,The flight path and time of the sighting led investigators to consider the possibility of a balloon.
witness description: Civilian witnesses including a painter and a carpenter.
